div.pre: 1451 Asia Minor, c. 1947 Burial: c. 187 B.C. (M) Contents: 11+ AR Antigonus Doson: 1 tetradr. Antiochus I: 3 tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Tigrim 2, Phocaea 1) Antiochus Hierax: 5 tetradr. (Sardes 1, Lampsacus 3, Alexandreia Troas 1) Antiochus III: 2 tetradr. (Ecbatana) Disposition: Sotheby Sale, April 1958 (Haughton) nos. 105a, 144-5, 156, 174, 182 Haughton's list of varieties purchased is in ANS. According to this and the sales catalogue, cat. nos. 200, 230-1, 237 (tetradr. of Demetrius I, Antiochus VII, and Deme- trius II, 2nd reign) were also present in the hd., but they are presumably intrusive. As Haughton recalled that the lot shown him contained "more Antiochus VII than anything else," however, it is possible that the intrusions derive from a second hd.
